comment.author: 92584783@N02
comment._content: The preliminary meeting to discuss the setting up of a mechanics institute took place at the Infants School, Frederick St, Launceston on 8 March 1842. My 3rd great-grandfather, Thomas Stubbs was one of the gentlemen present. His wife, Mary Ann (nee Girle) and his mother-in-law, Mary Martha Girle (nee Edwards) were teaching at the Frederick St school at the time so may have helped with the venue and meeting.

comment.author: 66613313@N00
comment._content: Demolished, now part of Civic Square front St John St
